content:
Hello All,
I'm trying to make an STU3, v1beta1, GCP-healthcare FHIR endpoint to validate profiles.

I'm using this page: https://cloud.google.com/healthcare/docs/how-tos/fhir-profiles as my source.

I've posted my profiles and implementation guide to my fhir store.

Unlike https://cloud.google.com/healthcare/docs/how-tos/fhir-profiles is suggesting, I've uploaded the implementation guide to the store via POST request, rather than via gcloud command. (Is this strictly necessary? I'd assumed it not to be.)

I've created a simple Patient profile that requires a patient's gender, I mapped this profile in the global field in the implementation guide.

The implementation guide has been enabled for the endpoint as well, via the updateMask-validationConfig PATH command.

Now, when I upload a Patient resource without a gender I'd expect to see an error, but I do not, the Patient is marked as being entirely valid:

"issue": [
{
"code": "informational",
"details": {
"text": "success"
},
"diagnostics": "success",
"severity": "information"
}
],

Any idea of what I'm missing?
you should ask google health cloud. They have a "Contact Us" button right on that page.

I did,
They appearently, currenly only support profiles with snapshots.
My profile had a differential.
Maurice Mulder has marked this topic as resolved.
